website_summaries.verdict: You'll pay a lot for this model, but it's easily one of the best mirrorless digital cameras around.
pros: Offers more than 20 megapixels of resolution
Extremely fast performer thanks to high-end image processor
Includes a 121-point auto-focus system that yields fast and accurate results
Offers 5-axis image stabilization to give sharp photos in low light
cons: Must spend extra to purchases lenses

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I ever used. I upgraded from Canon DSLRs
customer_reviews.text: Quick to focus, stunning image quality, every bell and whistle imaginable. I especially like the live bulb mode. Olympus is the only brand that lets you watch your long-exposure pictures develop, so you can close the shutter when everything looks perfect. You do need the best lenses to really make this camera shine. The body is small and light, and made photography fun again for me. I use my Olympus cameras both casually and professionally.
customer_reviews.author: Dixon Marshall

customer_reviews.title: I got the Right Camera for the Job
customer_reviews.text: I am a bird photographer and need a handheld camera setup that will allow me to move quickly to capture my fast moving targets with high quality. This camera did not disappoint. I am waiting for the Autofocus tracking firmware update to make it the best bird photography camera in the world. I hope Olympus lives up to its promise to do this firmware update.
customer_reviews.author: Alman

customer_reviews.title: I am happy to be using something 1/2 the size and 1/3 ...
customer_reviews.text: As basically everyone agrees, this is a very full-featured, versatile, pro-build M43 body. The pricing is a little more palatable now, but I spent $2k for mine a few months ago and I have no complaints. Everybody likes to complain about the "limitations" of M43, but after spending a decade shooting with full-frame pro Canon bodies and L lenses, I am happy to be using something 1/2 the size and 1/3 the weight. I will still whip out the 1D body and 85/1.2L for those rare, special occasions, but otherwise, it's M43 for me now.
customer_reviews.author: joe_n_bloe

customer_reviews.title: A super camera
customer_reviews.text: One of the great cameras, from someone who’s owned many. Returned a Nikon Z6 before purchasing. What a superior camera in every way. Yes: super high ISO is not it’s forte. But feature for feature, ergonomics, responsiveness, and system integration. Esp lenses, far exceeds mirrorless Nikon and rivals Sony. This camera is superb and is the culmination of engineering and experience that Olympus has gained from decades of making cameras (and I come from a Nikon and Sony user background). There is a lot of media propaganda about advantages orb full frame and imminent demise of M43. Use the camera and look at the results. You won’t look back.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Daniels

customer_reviews.title: this is the best camera for realistic photographers
customer_reviews.text: like: weather-sealed pro body from Olympus at the price of amateur bodies from competitors. I know Olympus sold off its imaging biz.But I'm gonna stick with m43 til the last m43 body becomes obsolete anywhere. camera body aside, olympus produces high quality lenses that are both small and inexpensive (compared to same tier lenses from CNS). what's not to like? get over the sensor size, folks, better invest in your photography practice (shoot more with a lightweight lens/body combo) and computer for post processing (smaller sensor= smaller raw files= lower need for computing raw power).
customer_reviews.author: bailey lab

customer_reviews.title: Feels great in the hand! Feature packed with new capabilities! I love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I have three other of the latest Oly camera body's. I love this one for it's 20mp sensor, the Pro Capture feature and superb/perfect handling. Of course the photos have great color and clarity. I miss having the scene mode on the mode dial, and I'm still learning how to use the three added positions: C1, C2 & C3. This camera was worth the price of upgrade from the EM 1 for sure... such added functionality!
customer_reviews.author: Pilot Mark in Arizona, USATop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from omd-em1 to mark 2
customer_reviews.text: The ability to photograph birds in flight is so much better in the Mark 2 version of this camera. Olympus really nailed continuous autofocus. Nice light camera, amazing photographs
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great travel camera, fantastic day shots, more noise in dark and ISO greater than 800
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera for my hiking, nature, or suburban exploring. The pro series lenses are second to none. Take a bit to get used to, a lot of customization options. This is not the best camera for night or low light shots for the beginner. In skilled hands more will find the ISO vs aperture vs shutter speed balance more manageable. The image stabilization is absolutely incredible. Great auto focus is you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Greenwalt

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Handy Camera
customer_reviews.text: My previous camera was an Oly E-620 and the E-M1 Mk 2 is clearly 2 generation more advanced in 4 important areas, noise at high ISOs, Autofocus, image stabilization, and just plain image resolution. Every aspect of camera operation, except perhaps the menu system, feels just blazingly fast. Just subjective but it seems it will boot from off, focus and take 2 pictures by the time my E-620 would wake from sleep and take one picture. The included bounce flash works nicely in any kind of home situation. .
customer_reviews.author: ac

customer_reviews.title: excellent 4/3 camera
customer_reviews.text: i just purchased this m1 mk2 and compared it to the m5 mkiii which my friend have, the m1 mk2 size is much fit to the hand hold. i strong recommend to have m1 mk2.
customer_reviews.author: ycon

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.  Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Best current mft camera hands down. For stills. I have both this and a gh5 and a gx8. This Olympus puts the Panasonic cameras to shame on stills. Video... Its still good. Excellent for most. If you want a camera to do video the gh5 is your camera only because of all of the shooting options.
customer_reviews.author: LongtimeAmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: First-rate Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is just perfect for my macro-photography. Lightweight, crystal clear images, and all kinds of neat control features! I love how it does focus stacking and focus bracketing, which is ideal for macro work! Highly recommended! :)
customer_reviews.author: Tom8Pie

customer_reviews.title: High speed shutter, Auto Focus and 5 axis IS!
customer_reviews.text: High-speed shutter, Auto Focus, and 5 axis IS are only a few of the features of this camera that make it a winner. I typically had poor luck capturing birds in flight. Granted large birds are easier to shoot, pare this body with a fast piece of glass and your keepers go way up.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Love

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Able to get this great upgrade on sale—a truly professional level camera. Camera received in a timely manner in perfect condition. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: earl

customer_reviews.title: Focus accuracy could be better; the Sony A6500 is way better in this ...
customer_reviews.text: Focus accuracy could be better; the Sony A6500 is way better in this regard. Even if you photograph people walking you will have a high miss rated. Disappointing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: VA Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: After shooting Sony for years and I decided to give MFT a go. It's ergonomically perfect. 3.3 update really changed my mind about the Olympus focus system. After putting it through it's paces I've decided its a keeper! 👍
customer_reviews.author: Carlous Dawson

customer_reviews.title: superb camera
customer_reviews.text: very good pictures. this is an upgrade from the M5 and looks much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Olympus brings superb quality on MFT format.
customer_reviews.text: High image quality on MFT format. Very sharp and light to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro P. R. Moreira

customer_reviews.title: Got a sweet deal so saved money and it was delivered a ...
customer_reviews.text: Timely and a savings. Got a sweet deal so saved money and it was delivered a little earlier than expected. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: So much great stuff (pro capture
customer_reviews.text: the only thing I'd change about it is the owners manual. Switched to this camera after 30 years as a Canon shooter; and after 6 months of use I haven't looked back. So much great stuff (pro capture, 60 fps, customizable to exactly the way you want it), fantastic lenses and at less than half the weight, and about a third less bulky. And as fast as cost - a heck of a lot cheaper, both bodies and lenses.
customer_reviews.author: R Schwalk

customer_reviews.title: The internal functions of the camera are not working!
customer_reviews.text: Hello there! Seller I found a problem with the camera you sold me! When the lens is installed and used, it cannot blur the focus system to work!
customer_reviews.author: jasonlin

customer_reviews.title: Pro-level gear and more compact.
customer_reviews.text: Well considered as the Olympus flagship camera. I've used Olympus gear for 15 years for all kinds of pro applications. It's never disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Peek

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional photographer that has used Olympus products (E-5's with Zuiko lens) for over 8 years. I bought one of these cameras just to try them out and WOW!!! I was so impressed with the quality of the imagines I sold all my big heavy camera gear and went 100% mirrorless camera bodies and lens.The weight difference of what I have to carry on long hikes is so much more manageable. Did I mention that I'm an old photographer lol.Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Improved in every way over E-M1
customer_reviews.text: For my purposes, I appreciate the noticeable increase in resolution and the improvement in AUTO-ISO performance in M exposure mode. I find that the high res mode works very well. It would be even better if it worked with focus stacking. Image stabilization is also noticeably improved and I have gotten 2" exposures. No regrets whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M. Axelrad

customer_reviews.title: Olympus Hit the Jackpot!
customer_reviews.text: An incredible camera that's fast, light and produces awesome images!
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Henry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent... best m4/3 out there bar none
customer_reviews.text: Best camera I've ever owned. IQ is amazing. Easy shooting experience. Love the speed and dual cards and dynamic range. I like the extra grip on the right side compared to the original em5. Be nice if it was a tiny bit smaller but then again the buttons are easier to use when they're larger. Overall it's just a fantastic shooting experience and the images and 4K video look amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Digelectric

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. I have the OMD 5 ii and this camera is much more responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera about says it all. I've shot with Canon, Sony and Nikon and I think this might be the most well thought out camera I've put my hands on. You probably know the strengths and weaknesses of this system if you are considering this, but if you enjoy micro four thirds this camera will blow you away.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K.

customer_reviews.title: State of the Art Camera, but the one I received was too buggy and froze too often!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this camera, and there is a lot to like: image stabilisation second to none, great size, solid build. But the camera I got had a flaw that was a deal breaker: sometimes, it just wouldn't turn on! It would start turning on and then freeze, with no way to get it to work except turning it off, waiting, and trying again. It didn't happen all the time, but it happened enough times to ruin several opportunities for photos. As I said, this was a dealbreaker for me and I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer2015

customer_reviews.title: impressive and compact
customer_reviews.text: First impressions, light, fast and so many buttons. Feature rich and all around fast performance. Paired with the 12-40 pro lens tested it out with my pup playing with toddler niece and nephew. Low light fast movement, this camera keeps up. Low noise on high 3200 ISO. Yes it is not a full frame, but the compact size trade-off debate is a dead horse. It is full of advanced shooting modes, but I have yet to test them all. The Android sharing app works, haven't tested tethering mode. Yes it is expensive but a compact, ie jacket pocket, And very impressive camera. I will update with test shots.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Olympus did a great job with this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Love it!! Previously owned a Panasonic GH3 so I love having a mirrorless camera. Still new to the camera so I will update later when I've had a chance to really get out with the camera and got to know all the features this camera has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: movieman413

customer_reviews.title: Really exciting camera!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, well, this is the item! It's probly the best camera to be released in the last few years. Innovative, pro level in almost every respect, waterproof, freeze-resistant, and filled with amazing features. Get it while it's hot!
customer_reviews.author: wiseGuy

customer_reviews.title: This is the one.
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and was expecting a super camera. I found that this camera is amazing and I've hardly use it so far, it fits in my hand like a talor made glove. It's quiet and fast I grabbed shots out of the box with no effort at all. I can see though thet it's going to take some time to learn all of it's features. I look forward to it, it's been fun from the start. You can believe most of the reviews this is a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: A Gottschald

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera, doesn't always work as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have been shooting Olympus equipment for a long time. I like the camera but there appear to be multiple bugs in the firmware.
customer_reviews.author: mbieser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Had the previous model and this is light years better.
customer_reviews.author: Cinzen

customer_reviews.title: Wrong charger replaced for return
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product and I think inadvertently placed the wrong charger in the box. I have the charger for the OM-D E-M1 and I'm missing my charger for the Olympus Pen F which I own. Please help me to make this right!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Cosloy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed , very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I love my Olympus OM-D EM1 and purchased the OM-D E-M1 Mark II hoping to upgrade it. However within 2 days , the on/off switch started giving problem. When flipped on it was not turning the camera on or when switching off , it was not turning off. The screen was only illuminated without any information. The eye sensor to turn viewfinder on was not working half the time and won't turn it on. The play back button also won't play back captured images half the time. I am returning the camera.
customer_reviews.author: RP

product_meta.title: Olympus OM-D E-M1 Mark II Camera Body Only, (Black)
product_meta.description: Style:Body OnlyThe OM-D E-M1 Mark II is an advanced system of innovative technology and features designed to forever change your photography: up to 18 frames per second sequential shooting with precision C-AF Tracking, 121 Cross-Type On-Chip Phase Detection AF points, up to 5.5 shutter speed steps of compensation with powerful in-body image stabilization, plus a 50MP High-Res Shot Mode. It’s all enclosed in a lightweight magnesium alloy weatherproof body. Paired with the superior resolution of Olympus M.Zuiko PRO lenses, the E-M1 Mark II will deliver brilliant imagery that’s coveted by professionals everywhere.Battery Life for Movie Shooting: Approx. 90 minutes (under standard JEITA testing) When used with .an authentic Olympus BLH-1 battery. Approx. 150 minutes (when zoom and other operational functions are not used) When used with an authentic Olympus BLH-1 battery. When repeatedly recording at the maximum time of 29 minutes.
feature_bullets: New TruePic VIII dual quad core image processor, auto focus points phase detection: 121 (121 cross type), contrast detection: 121
60 frames per second S AF, 18 frames per second C AF (silent electronic shutter)
15 frames per second S AF, 10 frames per second C AF (mechanical shutter)
121 point dual fast AF with cross type on chip phase detection focusing

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars106 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
